comment:
I had to retire my 6+year old Dell and mistakenly thought I could still use the same speakers in the new Dell. No such luck. I knew Amazon would have some for a decent price and so they did. Although I mostly use my computer for news, bills, etc., I also have my ultimate playlist of 4500 songs culled from my cd's and lp's that I use to make monthly playlists. There sure seems to be more bottom on these speakers than on the older Dell ones.

Perhaps my ear is not as discreet as that of other reviewers on here, but I am very pleased with these speakers.

Good old Amazon - always there with what I need!

theproduct: Dell AX210 USB ç«‹é«”è²æšè²å™¨ç³»çµ± (W955K), é»‘è‰²
comment:
I ordered these not to long ago, and didn't realize until I received them that I ordered two by accident (long story). That's fine though, I''ll just give on to a friend (or so I thought).

Both orders sounded okay. Nothing special, but definitely usable. You get what you pay for here. The first of them however, quickly developed a buzzing and popping noise whenever they were powered on. Unusable. I quickly returned them and got my money back. This works itself out though, now I've got just the one for myself, just as I intended.

That went downhill fast. I haven't had the second pair plugged in for 24 hours yet and they have already developed the same feedback issues. It really isn't worth my time to even return these anymore.

Update 01 Aug 18 :

I haven't had these speakers a month yet (the pair I didn't return), and they continue to get worse. Sometimes you can't use them at all, even through the noise. Look elsewhere. Stay away from these speakers.

Update 23 Aug 2020:

When I bought these, they were selling for $20, and they're now listed at $60. They weren't worth $20 then, and they sure as hell aren't worth 3x times that either.

theproduct: Dell AX210 USB ç«‹é«”è²æšè²å™¨ç³»çµ± (W955K), é»‘è‰²
comment:
Be sure to read reviews *by style*

Amazon bundles multiple very different products into one product page and differentiate them only by their 'style'. Fact is, these aren't the same products with different styles, these are completely different products. So, if you see someone that says "these speakers mounts to dell monitors", "volume knobs is a digital interface rather than a physical ones", that may not be true for the speakers you're getting. For my style, Volume knob is a physical interface that changes the volume independently, and they don't mount to anything.

theproduct: Dell AX210 USB ç«‹é«”è²æšè²å™¨ç³»çµ± (W955K), é»‘è‰²
comment: I may be relatively new to Dell products, but this is of such low quality that I have to wonder. The dial for the volume is not safe for fingers, there is a plastic edge of the speaker that will poke you when you turn the dial. Surely, if they used this speaker they would know this. The only reason I have it two stars is because there is sound..nothing impressive, but does relay sounds from my dell laptop.

theproduct: Dell AX210 USB ç«‹é«”è²æšè²å™¨ç³»çµ± (W955K), é»‘è‰²
comment:
These are decent speakers for the price. They have a bit of a bottom end(which is desirable for rock music), and make a decent enough representation of the sound. Not tinny like other cheap speakers. Decent sound for listening to music at a desk in an office - for which you don't need audiophile quality.

Though if you did have to rely on these as your primary speakers, you could do far worse for the price. They crank up pretty loud, and you don't hear the speakers rumbling or cracking in their enclosures.

I'd recommend them as a decent set of desktop speakers. For that simple need you don't need to look elsewhere.

So Overall These Are Great Speaker and I'm Glad I Bought These Instead Of The Other Ones I Looked At.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: I've had this soundbar for more than a year and I have not been disappointed. I use it everyday in my job for team calls, all hands and headset free. The sound quality is clear and crisp. theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment:
I was hesitant to buy this speaker for my Dell U2415 monitor based on so many reviews that said it didn't work as advertised (i.e. that it needed both a USB connection for power as well as an aux cable for the sound signal "THAT ISN'T EVEN INCLUDED!!!). Some folks even said that it didn't work with both a USB and aux cable connected.
But I wanted a speaker that wouldn't take up any space on my desk and I don't need disco club volume nor thumping base, so I went for it. I figured worst case I'd need to use an aux cable (or worst worst-case it wouldn't work for me at all and I have to return it, but hey, returning stuff is one of Amazon's strengths, right?)
So anyway it delivered next day after ordering (the joys of living in a metropolitan area!), I pulled it out of the box and connected the speaker's USB cable into one of the monitor's USB hub outlets and voila, sound was coming out of the speaker even before Skype and all of the other annoying Microsoft bloat-ware had finished starting up after I powered my computer on. Absolutely no setup of any sort required from me on the computer side of things. See the attached picture to this review for how the computer shows the speaker in the audio output section after all is said and done. So easy and I'm running Windows 8 on this machine, for Pete's Sake!

Which leads me to wonder; do people not realize that if you plug this speaker's USB plug into one of the monitor's USB ports that the monitor itself has to ALSO be connected to the computer independently via its own USB cord?
Even if you don't have your monitor hub connected (or don't have a monitor hub at all), the attached USB plug on the speaker has quite a long cord so hypothetically it would easily plug directly into the computer itself. I haven't tried that, but am absolutely confident it would work just fine. Even better, theoretically, since plugging the speaker into the monitor USB port instead of the computer's means the audio has the extra complexity of going through the USB hub in the monitor. Not that I've noticed any problems at all with that but I suppose if you were doing high data-rate transfers through the hub the sound could take a hit because of it.

Sound is perfectly fine, even great, for the size and price of this thing. Again, I don't need disco club volume nor thumping base nor battlefield realistic sound for my application so you may feel differently.
Actually I had to lower the speaker, computer, and music app volumes all down to the lower ends of their respective sliders while playing some test tracks since my kid's bedroom is right next to my "office" and the sound output was pretty significant when I first plugged it in.

My U2415 has two slots in the bottom of it that were covered up with some glorified tape pieces. Once I pulled the tape off with a mini-screwdriver the two tabs on top of the speaker slotted right into the monitor slots and it looks just like one of the photos Amazon has posted for this item.

If you go to Dell's page for this speaker, click on the "Tech Specs" tab, and scroll down to "Compatibility" you'll see a long list of Dell monitors this speaker is designed to work with. I'd guesstimate 2 out of 3 or maybe even 4 out of 5 in that list don't need the included monitor stand mount (the list differentiates which do or don't). Mine was one of those that don't so I can't speak to people's issues with the monitor stand mount, but I'm wondering if their monitor is even on that list at all.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: This was the O.E. Dell unit as advertised. Volume control was natively integral - there is a physical knob on the side for quick access, but it simply mirrors the same control as the sound card volume in the operating system. Sound quality was fairly good with sufficient clarity for a small, monitor-mounted device. Too many O.E. PC components can be easily overpriced versus its value, but I paid what I consider a "fair" price since it was less than half what it was listed on Dell's O.E. parts website.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: Great Speaker! Delivery was super fast! On a few sites about this speaker, a few people have complained about the sound from the earphone jack. When you plug in the earphone jack, do not push the 3.5mm plug in too far into the jack. This speaker sounds great and the earphone jack works just fine.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment:
Dell Stereo SoundBar- AC511M B07FZY2MJN
Got this for my moms computer, she is hearing impaired now. She had a set of Bose speakers that failed and the price to buy new ones is practically obscene now, and I felt those were way over priced to begin with.
She has a Dell home computer, and I wanted her to have something that would not take up any desk space, and that would install below the monitor easily. She's had this for over 4 months now and it is still going strong. Sound quality is good, crystal clear but base is kind of weak. I have these hooked up to a USB instead of a 3.5mm output, that way there is only one volume control, she would sometimes turn the volume down from the computer and wonder why she couldn't get any volume with the speakers control... problem solved. Also, this way I don't need a seperate power source, there's way too many wires below the computer desk already.
I paid $35.99 for these at the time, after installing and hearing them, I really don't think these are worth more that about $25 - $30. I also purchased a warranty on these, Bose wanted almost as much to fix as it would cost to replace them. And before these I went through 3 other pairs of computer speakers, all of them had volume control knob issues. And having sold electronics for years, back it the days when they were made in Japan, even then volume controls failing was a common issue on small audio devices, but now it seems even worse.
I do recommend this speaker, and my Mom seems happy with the overall performance of it, and I would most definitely buy again. I give it 4 stars instead of 5, because it is not price competitive, and I am paying for the Dell name.
I hope this helped with your decision.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment:
I was looking for a slightly better speaker option for a spare computer I occasionally do work on and came across this thing. I use mostly Dell products so this speaker seemed to fit in great. The mounting design is simple but great - just a spring-tension clamp mount adapter that grabs onto the neck of the Dell monitor stand and has a little rubber piece for grip and tension. The clamp will only fit on a certain Dell monitor stand which is the very common single neck found on probably 2/3rds of Dell monitors. The monitor I was using is one of the Dell gaming monitors that has a slightly different neck in the stand which was too wide to use this mounting clamp.

Luckily I had multiple Dell stands and they are (for the most part) all interchangeable for which I swapped stands and the mount fit like a champ.

If you like a clean factory look and you have the right stand this is great.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment:
I bought this for the external monitor on my office computer. I attach my laptop through a dock when I am at my desk, and I wanted a clutter-free speaker that was compatible with my Dell external monitor. So I'm not doing any gaming or listening to high-fidelity music, but I do have times when I have to play very low-quality audio and video recordings and make out what is being said, and my Dell laptop speakers are insufficient for that.

This replaced a monitor-soundbar setup I'd had since 2015. The sound quality here is MUCH better than it was with that older soundbar, and this speaker also seems to get louder and stay clearer at the louder range. I haven't tested that much yet, but it is important when I am listening to very soft recordings that I have to turn way up to hear. Obviously, for $30 you are not going to get world-class audio. But after reading some of the reviews, I was more than pleasantly surprised by the quality of sound coming out of these for a business computer.

As for connecting the sound, as others have mentioned, the only input is a USB cable. I prefer to plug the USB cable directly into one of the USB ports on my monitor, to minimize cable clutter. (I mounted the bar fairly high on the monitor pedestal so you cannot see the cable running from behind the speaker into the monitor when sitting at my desk). I've tried several combinations and unfortunately my monitor does not seem to receive/pass through audio using either a DisplayPort or HDMI cable. So the two options are either (1) plug the speaker's USB cable directly into your computer, or (2) run a USB A-B cable from your computer to the monitor. That USB cable is what carries the sound and allows the monitor to output sound through it's own USB cable. I chose to run a separate cable because I did not have any vacant USB ports on my dock. By running a single USB cable to my monitor, I can have use of 4 USB ports on my monitor for other devices, essentially turning my monitor into a USB hub. So in addition to this soundbar, I now plug my external webcam into a port on my monitor, and also plug my diaphragm microphone into the monitor on the rare occasions I use it, but once the monitor is connected to the computer by USB, you should be able to run most USB devices through it.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: I'm living in a small space right now and I recently had to replace a dying laptop which was being used for a bedside computer. The bedside computer is now a Intel NUC which is attached to a 22 inch Dell monitor which I pulled off of another system that now has a new monitor on it. I wanted to try a USB speaker solution rather than the older analog jack type speakers. After a bit of research I settled on the Dell AC511M soundbar because it attaches to the base of most current Dell monitors in the class of my aforementioned unit. As well, as long as the USB hub built into the monitor is plugged into the computer -- the soundbar can be plugged directly into the monitor. The audio from the soundbar is clear, crisp and has a decent amount of bass to it for it's size. Of course it's not going to beat a speaker system which has a sub woofer -- but it does run circles around my old laptop's speakers. There is one major issue which caused me to knock off one star. Because of the way this USB sound bar operates -- it cannot be controlled by Realtek software/drivers. Only basic Windows volume up/down functionality works. Which, this means that software such as the Realtek Audio Console absolutely will not work in terms of equalization controls because the sound bar is not seen by it. What's worse -- I could not find any solution either on Realtek's or Dell's websites that could resolve the issue. In the end I had to go with a third party solution I found on Sourceforge that does work. I don't understand why this is like this because USB speakers have been out for years now and I cannot believe that Realtek hasn't done something about this issue. Particularly, since Realtek plays such a major role when it comes to audio systems for computers. Other than the aforementioned issue the AC511M soundbar is good for the use I intended it for.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: Out of the box the sound is muffled garbage and was about to return it when I discovered the open-source PC software called Equalizer APO that lets you apply equalization to ALL of Windows sound and microphone drivers. This speaker has enough power for desktop use and I was able to set up an excellent EQ profile to redeem it. Ordered a second one for another machine and will do the same thing. Don't expect movie-like surround sound but Spotify and YouTube videos now have decent fidelity for me to enjoy this product.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: Great size and sound - my dedicated speaker for 2nd pc, fixed my issue of trying to constantly switch my 5.1 between my two computers. Sound is nice and clear with good depth - projects sound very well, quite bose-ish. Wish there was some way to clip it to my monitors stand (my dell monitor does not have the clips for it to attach directly to the bottom of the monitor sadly). Had to make due with it sitting on a couple of books underneath the display. Sound is great - esp given the fantastic price - cord is plenty long too. Love that it's long and thin - makes it very inconspicuous, JBL would make me buy something round and large and impossible to place out of the way. Dell did this exactly right and are selling it for half what they should be...

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment:
I bought this to use with a TV. Seemed simple enough - there's an aux-in, and my TV has a USB port for power. so I thought 'great'. I plugged it in and both of those were fine, I got power and sound, EXCEPT that turning the volume control had no effect. There was only ever ONE volume (LOUD). I then hooked it up to my computer, and sure enough, when I spun the volume control, MY COMPUTER'S volume changed, and hence so did the speaker. Seems it is specifically made to communicate via USB to your COMPUTER to control the volume. Without a computer, you can't change the volume - at least not with any of my TVs.

The sound is good for it's size, and I'm sure I'll find a use for it with one of my computers, so I'm going to keep it for the price. Just don't think you're going to use it with anything other than a computer.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: My old computer speakers died and I decided to try this sound bar from Dell. Yes, these do not sound like Bose speakers, but they certainly work well enough for me. I normally plug headphones into the jack which gives a good audio experience. The downside is that the setup guide has no words at all, and the drawings are very confusing. This item comes with a bracket that fits around the base stand of your monitor. It works with most newer Dell monitors, but check to make sure it works with yours. Well the brackets sort of fit, but the bar kept falling down. Eventually I figured out that this unit actually clips into two holes on the bottom of my monitor. You have to remove the plugs in those holes and then the bar slides right in. It was my son who figured out how to get it properly installed and out of the way. So the bracket assembly did not apply to my monitor. Another odd thing is that this item does not plug into an audio jack, but uses USB. All in all a very neat addition to my monitor for an excellent price.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment:
I bought this for my 24H17 monitor. According to all information found on the web I need AC511M, which comes with a bracket, to hang the sound bar on my monitor stand.
It turned out that the bracket could not be fitted as the width of my monitor stand was too wide.
Out of despair I flipped my monitor and discovered that the mounting holes existed but were covered by black inlays.
So eventually I hung the sound bar directly to my monitor after removing the inlays.
Is this an example of how Dell forces customers to buy additional accessories?

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: I get needing power from USB to power the speaker. But it won't let you use the aux jack unless it's plugged into a USB port that has a data stream - so no just plugging it into a charger. This is fine if you're going to use it just for the computer, but beware if you plan on using it like I did - for playing a game console.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: While the sound is excellent, the volume must be controlled on the PC. This is a step backward from the old days when there was a volume control knob on your speakers. This makes it difficult when watching videos because they all seem to stream at different volumes so I constantly have to fiddle with the PC to adjust the volume. Finally, I'm using pretty standard HP monitors but haven't figured out how to attach the sound bar to either monitor. Therefore, it just lays there on the table surface. It's not ideal but it works, I guess. My recommendation is that this product is just okay. Had I known then what I know now, I likely would have chosen something else.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: Better sound than I was expecting from a small sound bar. Doesn't fit my Viewsonic monitor but it slides under the screen and I can make it work with a remote switch for the monitor power. (Power button is under the screen.)

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment:
I got this for a desktop computer I was building and added it under my Dell monitor. I use it for conference calls, not for music. It plays music just fine and plenty loud but it is a soundbar. Simple USB cable was plug and play with Windows 10. Zoom, MS Teams, etc... all recognize it. It is small and discreet but the buttons are big enough for you to find and press with ease. Check the compatible Dell monitor stands but it attached with ease to mine.

Sounds: Voices are loud and clear for calls. The soundbar has volume adjust buttons which increase or decrease the Windows volume control. The sound is a bit deeper and richer than you get from typical "tinny" sounding PC speakers. I have not run into any issues with audio.

Mic: This unit has an integrated far-field microphone. I typically sit 2-4 feet from the microphone and it picks my voice up well. Feedback has been that I sound clear on calls. There is a mute button on the soundbar, in addition to buttons for answer and hang-up, which could be handy in certain circumstances. The microphone on this soundbar is far better than the integrated mic on my USB camera. However, I would say it's generally of average sound capture quality. I have had no issues with it and it is sufficient for hours of daily conference calls.

I have attached pictures of the front view under monitor and the rear view of the mounting adapter.

I purchased this because it had an integrated microphone. I believe that is the key feature to choose this soundbar over all other alternatives available. The second feature would be mounting compatibility with Dell monitors. The third feature would be the inclusion of front mounted buttons for volume, mute, and call handling if someone were looking for a setup without easy access to a keyboard or mouse (i.e. distributed setup or TV display as a conferencing interface).

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment:
did not snap under my Dell monitor, I guess Dell changed the same model.

Velco to hold the sound bar on the the top of the monitor works well

--- Great Sound

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: so the seller is amazon (not a third party) and i buy this soundbar during prime days. learned my lesson. first of all, it only works through USB for a few (very few) dell monitors. so the reviews saying it is easy peasy to install are wrong. it is easy to install on a few (very few) select dell monitors. for the rest of us there is the mandatory internet search on how to install this sound bar. somewhere on the internet i am given the advice to connect the sound bar directly to my sound card and in the end, that was the scenario that worked. i tried using the "missing" wire (no where to be seen in the box but listed all over the dell website). i finally used the wire i had from a pair of logitech speakers i threw out. tried connecting the sound card to the monitor and got nothing. reset every switch and setting in windows 10 and then gave up and connected to the sound card on my computer directly to the soundbar like you would on any normal speaker. but there is a trick here also.... you need to select "Speakers SB Recon3D PCle" not "SPDIF-out SB Recon3D PCle".... thank you guy on the internet with that advice..... when all was said and done, i got the sound bar working. and i loved it the first day. had a ball, its my personal computer which is catty corner to my work computer and sat and played tunes all day. BUT THE NEXT DAY (just after the sale) the price went down and i paid more because i bought it during prime days. in the end, the speaker is nothing special. it looks nice on a dell set up but the aggravation to get it installed and then paying more during a sale.... i do not recommend this soundbar... follow up, 9 months later. soundbar is terrible. works about 1/3 of the time. and now its working but it goes in & out, it will play the instrumental parts but it muffles the singing. very odd. what a waste of money

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment:
I looked at quite a few reviews on this and other products before purchasing. Made my head hurt because there was a lot of love and hate. So let me pile on.
- Product arrived well packaged and unharmed
- Unboxing was uneventful
- Setup was very simply (mount, connect, use)
- Plug and Play. Computer recognized and loaded drivers (used computer for USB power)
- Sound is solid and gets plenty loud. I listened to music, spoken words and video conference. For all three it showed surprisingly good frequency response with very good clarify. I accidentally ran the volume is all the way up with music and it held up surprisingly well. It did't fall apart, but was beginning to distort (not unexpected).
- Mic performed well (one use). People on the conference said my voice was clear, loud enough, understandable and was not affected by speaker sounds.
- Mount is very solid on the stand, although I was worried is would snap before I got it mounted to my Dell U2520D stock stand. The bracket barely fit, but it did not break.

Overall I recommend this speaker/mic system for use on computers. It is not an expensive speaker system and probably won't make audiophiles happy, but for what it is it works quite well. Just be ready to come up with a mount if the one they provide doesn't work out.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment:
Great little speaker, much better alternative vs having speakers take up what limited space I have on desk. The sound isn't amazing, but at the same time it isn't bad. For me this has been perfect purchase, would definitely buy it again if I needed it.

One downer, was hoping the usb connection was just for power, and audio would actually be delivered over hdmi... unfortunately that is not the case. In windows, I can't select my dell monitor as the output speaker (well I can but no audio), must use the newly added audio source "Speakers (Dell AC511 USB SoundBar)"

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: Speaker works good .Mounting bracket wouldnâ€™t fit my monitor. So I used double sided tape to fasten it to base worked out just fine.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: This is probably my favorite work from home purchase. My work-issued laptop is a lemon and the speakers blew out within the 1st month of issuance. Due to the shortage of loaner laptops, my Tech team just told me to purchase an external speak to plug into. After trying a couple of cheap but cheerful speakers, I came across this soundbar. It affixes perfectly onto my Dell monitor (UP2716D) and helps save desktop space. Installation was very easy, sound is clear, and volume easy to control. I love this thing.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: I love the quality of sound from this soundbar. It works great with my computer. It was easy to connect it to get started, however I wasnâ€™t able to hook it up on my monitor, so it sits right below the screen on the base. Otherwise, itâ€™s a wonderful product for the price.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: I have been using the same Logitech speakers from Walmart for 10 years at 2 different jobs. They still worked but I hate wires and cords. I bought this sound bar to eliminate desk clutter and wires. It has delivered that and more. The speaker sounds great compared to the Logitechs, louder and better sound. My favorite feature is how it slips on to the bottom of my compatible Dell monitor and takes up no desk space. It gets power and input from the USB cord that plugs into the back of the monitor. One cord that I never have to see or deal with! I love it! I highly recommend this speaker. I knew this was compatible with my monitor because I could feel little tabs that peeled off on the bottom of the monitor that exposed the mounting holes for the speaker, very straightforward. The speaker has tabs that slide in and to the right in the holes.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment:
The design and form is nice except that the in port and headphone port are strangely on the side but that is not a big problem. The picture of the mounting bracket posted in the description is misleading (see my picture) as the bracket only possibly work with very thin monitor stands and there is no way to tell this from the description. It does not fit my 32" LG monitor stand, As others mentioned, the input requires 3.5 mm cable that is not included. The instruction does not contain a single word besides somewhat cryptic pictures. For example, there is no description on a knob on a right hand side with an arrow only pointing in one direction (see picture). It is volume control but it rotates continuously in both directions.
The speakers give good sound at high volume for their size when plugged to a USB port. Win 10 recognized the unit w/o any problem. The volume can be controlled with a knob or through Win 10. However, less success with audio in. I tried with different sources and different cables and I could not get it working. Possibly the problem is

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: There is static noise when no other sound is coming out of the speaker (loud enough to be annoying). Also the volume dial is difficult to adjust, ultra sensitive, and knocks the volume way down as soon as it's touched. Turning the dial jumps the volume around randomly too (not just a linear increase or decrease).

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: Decided to grab a soundbar to live under an Acer monitor, and went with this because it's USB powered and driven, and doesn't require a power outlet or have RGB lights that I have to turn off every time it powers on. I'm surprised at how well it sounds, and the volume knob on the side is very nice and sends input back to my Dell XPS. It actually changes the volume from my computer and not the sound bar itself, so when I unplug it and go back to my laptop I don't get shocked with full volume or something. The moment I plugged it in, it required no setup and the USB connection noise actually played through the sound bar itself. But, that might helped since it's a Dell sound bar that got plugged into a Dell laptop. My laptop may have already had their driver's installed, so I can't comment on that front.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: I mounted the control below my compatible Dell monitor, plugged into a USB slot on my laptop, and booted up my system. The sound bar worked immediately. Sound was great. I verified that I could operated the soundbar by plugging the USB cable into a USB hub connected to my laptop. If the USB connection did not offer sound, my understanding is that an audio cable purchased separately would work, but I did not check this out. If my Dell monitor did not have slots to support mounting the sound bar, I verified that the sound bar does attach to the Dell monitor stand. If you have a different, incompatible monitor, you can place the sound bar on your desktop. One of the nice side benefits of this sound bar is that you can adjust the volume by touching the sound control on the right hand side of the bar. The control does not spin. It is sensitive to the movement of your finger. There is no need to open a volume control window by a separate action. The window opens automatically when you touch the control disk. You still have control of volume through a mouse or touchpad if that is more convenient in your setup. The best thing about the soundbar is the sound reproduction. It is surprisingly good, and greatly improves reproduction of youtube musical videos over what is available from my laptop speakers.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment:
I havenâ€™t had audio on my pc set up since I purchased it a couple years ago. I have always used headphones.
So getting this speaker was a great addition. If you are like me and just looking for an affordable quality speaker to get you some decent sound, this is a good buy.
I only use this speaker to watch videos and play casual video games. So thatâ€™s where my perspective comes from.
I didnâ€™t need the mount that came with the speaker. I wall mounted mine below my monitor arm.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: The sound bar provides great sound that I am happy with. The only complaint is that the listing is not very clear that it will only mount to certain types of monitor stands. It won't mount to the round post of my monitor stand so it is just sitting on a nearby shelf.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment:
Bought this for my work computer. I'm in an office by myself most of the year so I wanted something to replace my current speakers with sooooo many wires. One cable, nice and clean set up. The bracket didnt work for my monitor stand (expected so I won't consider that a negative) so the speaker is sitting on the desk beneath my monitor. With my old speakers I had to have the volume around 60/70 to have it loud enough to hear but low enough to not annoy the office next to mine. With these, I have it on 1. yes ONE! and it is plenty loud! Turned it up to 30 and the office down the hall from me told me they could hear it.

My only concern is I do a lot of Zoom calls now and the one I did so far I didn't get any volume so I had to unplug it and plug my headphones into my computer. Im sure i can fix this in zooms setting.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: I bought this to pair with my Dell UltraSharp U2720Q 27 inch 4k monitor. Now I understand that they say that it is not compatible with that monitor, but hear me out. When you try to attach it, you will notice that is does not fit, but if you take out the rubber part, you can clap it onto the base of your monitorâ€™s stand. So far, it has worked wonders and it looks great. The sound is not top notch but I got mines on sale for like $25 and for that price, I found it to be a steal. It can get pretty loud without distortions, and you really only need the volume to go half way.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: I ordered it hoping it could mount on my Viewsonic VP2771 and it does. It works well but I added a little earthquake putty to keep it from sliding down the stand, I think it would slide on the Dell monitor stand also. The sound comes through the USB connection. I also have an Apple TV connected via the HDMI port, and the sound is not routed to the speaker, so I used the analog input jack and connected it to the monitor's analog output jack. It works, but when there is a jack in the input port I hear a little static when I scroll the screen, which could be from the RF interference from the monitor or the Bluetooth mouse. Volume control on the speaker adjusts my Macbook Pro's volume slider. The speaker sound is good, but not as deep and rich as external speakers with a subwoofer, but it is good enough for general use not specific to music.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: The dialogue clarity is amazing on this speaker. For the price, I havenâ€™t heard anything better. Donâ€™t look for booming bass or equalizer controls, but I was really impressed by the overall quality. Unfortunately, this definitely will not work for a multi-monitor setup unless all your sound-providing applications are on the same monitor as the speaker. That said, I would happily use this monitor for everyday use (not sound mixing or editing).

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: If you want just a speaker then for $21 this is best option. I am not even using it for Dell computer at all and it works perfect. Plug the USB in and it is ready for action. It is not loud or have the best sound quality but it only cost $21. Don't expect life changing around for this amount of money. If you want to use it with aux input then you will need a usb power source and an aux cable but if you using it with a computer then just plug the USB in and it's good to go. Mount it comes with does not fit the acer monitor I have so I ended up using double sided tape to mount it under the table now I have sound and speaker is out of sight.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment:
Sounded great at first, nice and clear and the surround sound effect is great but not even a year in and the sound has degraded significantly. Bought Oct, 21' and it did great for about ten months then I began to hear distortions and crackling, at the time I was using the line in feature so I thought it might be the old cable I was using, bought a new one and it sounded the same, no improvement. It still works but the sound is not as rich as it was and the volume level seems to have limited itself to only 50% level. I took it to goodwill rather than throw it out.
Side note: you can use it with other speakers or subs as long as you are using the line-in input, and you plug the USB cable into an external power source, if you plug it into the back of your computer it will output sound through USB automatically and you can't change that.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment:
My Dell monitor had provisions to direct-mount this unit and a USB plug on the back of the LCD to direct-wire it to. I bought the unit it in order to simplify using Skype for Business and MS Teams in my small home office. The unit didn't disappoint!

Install was a breeze, just pop it on, attach the USB to a hub or your computer, then get to making adjustments. Configuration was a little clumsy, but I've worked in the IT world longer than I'd like to admit, so I was able to adjust my sound settings and make this the primary device. For calls where I need to use a headset, I don't have problems with Skype for Business selecting the speaker over my headset. Teams took a bit of fumbling at first to figure it out.

Sound quality is good, both from my side, and people I call say it sounds like I'm on a headset. Full disclosure, I did have an issue with interference from my wireless access point which sits on my desk under the display this speaker is attached to. That resulted in people I called hearing a rhythmic clicking or popping sound (I couldn't hear it, took a couple calls before someone pointed it out). Solution was simple, move the wireless access point more than 24" away, problem solved. Calls are clear as can be.

I've had this for a couple months now. I still haven't really used the button controls on the front of the unit very much. I normally adjust all of those settings from inside the app using the speaker. I guess they're nice to have, just not something I necessarily need. YMMV.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: The speaker bracket that is to clip onto my Dell computer screen stand is made for a rectangular stand with 90 degree corners. Since my Dell computer screen stand has rounded corners, the speaker can't be securely attached to my screen stand. As a result, the speaker falls off the stand every time I turn the speaker volume control knob. Also, if the speaker volume control knob protruded farther out from the speaker, it would be easier to grab.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: I believe as others have noted this will work on some Dell Monitors, but some models have too wide of a monitor support for the handy monitor connector to work. I have a 2 year old Dell Monitor I purchased at Costco, a 27" with a post that is about 3.8" wide. I knew this might not fit going into this from reading other customer reviews and reviewing the propduct pictures. I am docking Dell one star because they really should think about making products that are compatible with their own brand (duh!). I was able to get it to work with use of a Dremel tool and some zip ties and everything turned out neat and tidy. Setup was a breeze, just plugged it into my docking station USB. Sound is good for what it is with not too much distortion at the upper volumes. Overall I am happy with it as it does what I needed it for and that was to give me better sound than my laptop speakers and not take up any real estate on my desk.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment:
I recently switched to a m1 mac mini which doesn't have speakers (worth using). I already had a dell P2715Q but needed to add speakers. These hang under the monitor and plug into the USBs on the back of the monitor as well (which works as a USB hub for the mac mini). It's a great setup. This version (AC511M) has no mic so think of that if you'll need one (but most web cams do). There are 2 audio jacks on the side, one headphone and the second is line in. If you plug headphones in they work great and the speaker mutes. The quick start guide shows headphones with a mic for the front headphone jack but the mic portion doesn't seem to work? There's a dial to the right that controls volume. With my mac mini and apple keyboard volume on the keyboard works (system volume so that makes sense) but the dial on the speak also brings up the same on screen volume display which is nice.

TLDR: very nice and tidy speaker solution of you own a monitor it attaches to.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: So, I wasn't expecting to get BOSE quality for this price, and BOSE it's not. But I wanted something streamlined that wouldn't take up as much space on my desk as my little box speakers that I've had for years. Also something that would enable me to be on Zoom calls without having to have a headset on. I had my fingers crossed that the quality would go up a notch from those but I can't say that I can tell the difference. I'm truly a techno-twit (a woman in my 70s) and I had the sound bar connected to my monitor with music playing within 10 minutes of unpacking the box. Options for controlling the bass are almost nonexistent but there is a bass booster you can check out. All in all, I'm happy with the purchase and wouldn't return because it does meet my limited needs.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: I didn't use the clip due to my monitor being thinner than the provided clip but it does the job. USB cable is an all in 1 solution and is about 3-4 feet if i had to guess. Its definitely a lot louder than the built in mac mini speaker! I like the volume knob on the right side of the speaker. I would recommend :)

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: I don't have a Dell monitor so I couldn't clip it on. But it's fine to just set down. I dont use for music but for everything else, sound is perfect. Volume control knob could be a bit tighter but it dies allow complete control. All in all a great value.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: Had to use tie wraps to install bar to monitor support. Do not know which Dell monitor it fits. But I didn't have it. Three different monitor supports look similar but have varying widths and thickness of supports. This fit none of them.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: Quality is really bad, but it works and outputs noise. In hindsight tho I wish I never wasted my money on these speakers and bought something with more quality

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment:
I purchased this AE515M soundbar because people were complaining that the sound from my webcam microphone had a lot of echo. I'm using this soundbar on a an Apple computer, not a Windows PC.

So far, people I have called using the new soundbar have said that the audio is good, with only a hint of echo that is not objectionable. I am using Apple FaceTime, not Skype.

The volume up and down buttons work and so does the microphone on-off button. It appears that the phone call buttons do not work with my Apple computer but I may find a way to make them work later (not sure).

It fit my Dell 25" Ultrasharp monitor perfectly. And, unlike my previous Dell soundbar, it recognized the USB audio right away. I do not need to use the sound-in jack on the new soundbar like I did with the old one.

The audio is not as good as with my previous Dell soundbar. To me, it sounds slightly shrill and "tinny". I have kept the old soundbar hooked up for when I must have better audio. I just lay it on my desk under the monitor.

If they could make a version of this soundbar that was 100% Apple compatible with the slightly better sound quality of my old Dell soundbar, I'd be thrilled.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: This works great and has good sound for the money. It sounds way better than the $20 stand-alone speakers. One thing to note, however, is you probably want to power it with an external power supply. I used the USB on the computer and got a bit of power supply noise. Using a Samsung phone charger eliminated all noise.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: The stem of the all-in-one 2419 HC computer and monitor is too thick and wide. I was able to modify this problem with a piece of wood cut to fit the speaker bracket and raise the speaker to below the screen and then ziptie/small bungee to stem. Painted it black and works great. Speaker is excellent sound but I wouldn't want it on my desk. You could also velcro it to the bottom of the monitor screen if the bracket doesn't fit. I did a lot of research to make sure it fit but no one really mentioned the all-in-one computers.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: I'm plugging the speaker into my Dell monitor and I was getting some really annoying white noise / buzzing. Thanks to a reviewer on another speaker listing who recommended a Ground Loop Noise Isolator, the noise is now gone. If Dell knows this issue exists, how could they not, they should include a Ground Loop Noise Isolator with the speaker, As it was, I only had to spend a couple dollars for one, and it did solve the issue - but I shouldn't have had to do that.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: Here's the deal . Do you have a desk full of things? a big screen 27" , no place to put your notes or coffee mug? Well, my solution to get more space was getting rid of the speakers, and buying this sound bar and fixing it below the screen like in the picture. Problem was that to fix it, it has two hooks to fix in to dell monitors. No way, no dell monitor here. It also has a clamp, to fix to non-dell monitor poles, but clamp is to small, cannot grab into my gigabyte screen. Solution , cut off the hooks and glue to monitor base with plastic cement - let dry over night and problem solved. Very happy with the sound bar. My desk looks uncluttered , the side wheel is the best solution i have met to rise or lower the volumen. Fair enough. Buying another one for my 32" screen. Last but not least only one USB cable, to get the power and the audio. One cable. Plug in and it works straightforward. Cant be simpler.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: I use this for editing and wanted a soundbar with a headphone jack. After trying another brand at the same price point, I found this one to have better sound quality and to be surprisingly compact (and it mounts directly to my Dell monitor). It also feels like it's made from better materials. The only reason it doesn't get five stars is because of a constant white noise when the computer is on, regardless of what the volume is set at. The only way I can beat it is to plug in headphones when I'm not using it. The noise is low but noticeable in a quiet room. Wish I knew how to get rid of it.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment:
All-in-all am happy with this product, since it looks nice and the sound is good. Was surprised that the grip (the soundbar's attachment handles) was NOT adjustable to different monitor leg stand circumferences. I work with two monitors, one of them isn't a Dell, and I couldn't attach the soundbar to it. Strange that they limited this product to Dell monitors.
In the instructions it's written to attach the USB cord to one of the monitor's USB slots, but that didn't work for me--there was no sound when doing so. Inserting the soundbar's USB in one of the PC's USB slots made it work.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: This was a great speaker and especially great value. Unfortunately, it did not fit on my stand. It said it would and Dell said it would but it didnâ€™t. I was sad to return it.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: I was a little concerned when ordering this 6 weeks ago regarding the notes re poor sound quality and mounting. Regarding the sound quality it works very nicely in Zoom style meetings. I hear the others clearly and they hear me quite well. My Rock and Roll music plays directly from the computer. Overall, the sound quality is much better than I expected given the prior negative reviews. My headphone set-up plugs directly into the soundbar when I want to mute the speaker. My Dell screen mount was a bit too wide for the small clamp on the mounting bar, consequently the sound bar was slightly unstable. I used three 7/8" Velcro sticky back fasteners on the mount and the bottom of the monitor. The bar is now firmly attached to the monitor, up and clear of the desk and the "look" is clean. I am very pleased with this soundbar, especially given the low price!

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: Sounds good! Very easy set up. Good value for the power it puts out. However only see it for zoom meetings

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment:
First thing I want to say is that I wish Dell offers more flexible mount that works for newer/bigger monitors. However, don't move away from this awesome speaker just because your monitor is incompatible with the mount. You can just use 3M Command tape to attach it to the bottom of your monitor like how I did in the picture.

This speaker is for someone who doesn't want to wear headset for conference call. The echo cancellation works great as long as you keep speaker volume in reasonable level. I found echo cancellation works better if you just keep the microphone always on rather than turning it on only when you want to speak.

It is a 5W speaker and music performance is decent, but it won't satisfy you if you compare it with proper PC speaker like Bose. To me, it sounds great and I enjoy listening music from it.

What you get is a very convenient USB speaker that you don't need to use 3.5mm cable to your PC and echo cancelling microphone that works great.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment:
I love the sound from my sound bar for conference calls most of the time, but at least once a day it produces a lot of static for the person that I'm talking to. I've never heard it myself, but people say that it's awful and I have no way to tell that it is happening. I can switch my microphone to the laptop microphone and it goes away. I wish I could trouble-shoot it, but it's random and I don't know how to reproduce it, so I'm going to have to stop using it!

Edited September 2022 - I kept using this and it stopped doing the static thing! I donâ€™t know how or why!

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment:
Clips onto the vertical stand, not the monitor itself. As I usually have the monitor at the lowest horizontal position, pretty much can't even see it. Yet, the sound is not obstructed. I haven't used the phone features, but everyday use, the sound is just fine, not at all tinny.

Physically, it is smaller than I had hoped. Plug and play. The tiny attached USB cable plugs into the bottom of the monitor, right side; I'd rather the cable was out of sight, but that's more of a complaint about the placement of the ports on the monitor. Would purchase this again.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment:
So this is a true USB speaker. Meaning that it has a built-in DAC, whereas there are speakers that are powered by USB for power only and still use the analog line-in for sound.

The one drawback is that the volume control is digital. The knob on the right side of the speaker doesn't actually change the volume on the speaker itself. It tells windows to change the volume level digitally. It's not a potentiometer that changes the volume of the speakers. Why is this a drawback? So if you're not playing anything all you hear is the hiss of white noise which means the gain is turned all the way up amplifying the noise.

Also, there is no physical power button. So if you have this plugged into a matching Dell monitor it only turns off when you turn off the power on the monitor and the integrated USB hub is powered down as well.

In short, you can't adjust the actual gain of the speaker and you hear white noise all the time when nothing is being played and you can't turn it off to avoid hearing the noise.

As for sound. It's really flat, the

It's ok for $34.98. Is it the best speaker you can get? Probably not, but it doesn't take up desk space and it's plug and play. I'm not sure the AE515M is any better besides some integrated buttons for Skype and a built-in microphone.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment:
The good: The sounds bar mounts great to my Dell monitor and is a very clean look. Keeps my desk from being cluttered.
The not so good: There is a faint constant white noise being emitted from the speaker. Doing an internet search does that this has been a problem with this speaker for 7+ years that hasn't been addressed by Dell. It isn't loud, but annoying if you have a quiet office.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: I replaced a much more complicated satellite and subwoofer setup from Boston Acoustics with this nice, compact little package to clean up the mess of wires strung around my desk and pc. Nowhere near the sound quality but I have a home stereo for listening to music so all I need is something to play occasional videos and home office use. The mount didn't fit my Dell 2340M monitor but a zip tie fixed that. Simply zip tied the speaker bracket to the top of the monitor stand and voila! Looks factory installed and works great.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: Michael Dell... what an absolute Legend to Austin, not McConaughey BTW. I have loved his stuff for decades and have found their stuff worthy for all my computing needs. I did once buy a Compaq after a bender on Mezcal, which turned out to be a horrible decision. I digress. The sound bar fits snugly on the bottom of my sleek monitor and worked when I plugged it in. It came with an additional mount to attach to a Dell Monitor Stand. I incorporated a Mount-It arm, not impressed btw, so I didn't need the stand. I haven't blasted any tunes out of the sound bar, so cannot provide a review on the sound quality of Iron Maidens "In-A-Gadda-Da-Vida" or the subtle tones of Bach's "Toccata and Fugue in D minor". So there's that.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: I have some older Dell monitors that take the analog under-monitor speakers (AX510). The AC511 comes with a physical adapter that can make it fit on almost any monitor. I ended up using the adapter with some tape to secure to the top of my monitor. This is an infinitely superior experience to the AX510 and all the analog hums it would pick up. For day to day telecon work, it's perfect!

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: The mounting didn't work for my work-at-home set up. The newer dell monitors i have didn't have the hook openings that the speaker has. The headset plug allows for a headset/microphone to work.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: I purchased a Samsung monitor with no speakers so I purchased this one. Impressed with the sound. I can't use the included mounting bracket because it doesn't fit my monitor stand (I knew this before I purchased it) but I have a block of wood that it sits on underneath my monitor and looks good.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: I like this soundbar. The sound is clear and gets pretty loud. I have a USB 3.0 on my DELL P2418HT Touchscreen monitor. The device has mounting brackets to attach to some monitors. I had to go with AC511M because it provides a mounting bracket. The bracket did not fit like in the picture. The shape of the stand for the monitor was too wide. It was able to attach backwards. Like a soundbar for a HDTV, I merely positioned the soundbar under the monitor on top of its base. I added Scotch gripping pads to aid with sliding and it leans back a bit. Perfect! Buy the soundbar for the quality of the sound it produces. You might decide to trash the mount. Unless it actually fits, then your good to go...

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: This speaker was a great purchase. I needed something low-profile, simple to use, had decent sound quality and would hopefully get the speaker off of my stand-up desk. This speaker met all of these specifications and at a great price. The picture from the right shows the volume knob. I just set the volume in the middle and use my keyboard buttons to control the volume. If you don't have this the volume knob is very easy to use. I'm using this mostly for work, web-calls and and other non-musical uses. It puts out decent sound for music but audiophiles will likely want something with stereo sound and more base.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: The sound quality is better than I expected. The design is sleek. The only thing is that the mount doesnâ€™t work with my Dell monitor??

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: For the price, Recommended.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: Does just what it's supposed to do. Nice sound, easy install.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment:
Decent sound and a definite improvement over the built-in speakers of my Mac laptop. The sound bar attaches easily to my Dell Ultrasharp 3219 display and remains mostly out of sight. It is capable of generating a decent volume. I appreciate it being USB power so simply plugging it into an available USB port on the display reduces cable clutter.

The price was reasonable considering other options and the integration and final result completely meets my needs.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment:
Great addition to the monitor, unfortunately out of the box this speaker's sound is unbearable...it's so muffled, it sounds like it's still in the box because the high frequencies are soooo cut off. I considered returning it, as in this price range one can alternatively purchase a really nice sounding sound bar of a different brand.

In the end I kept it for the convenience and fixed the muffled sound problem by downloading the open source and free software called Equalizer APO. I've included a screenshot of my EQ config. I find that config works best on this sub-par speaker!

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: Sound quality is good, nice and loud but as others mentioned, it definitely hums when no music is being played. My office has a noisy pond nearby so it's not as noticeable for me but if you're looking for complete quiet when off, these aren't it. They do not factory fit my Dell U2415 monitor. The mount supplied isn't strong enough to hold the weight of the speaker so it slides down to the monitor base. I ended up installing a zip-tie to hold it tighter, it works, just not what I was expecting. Oh, and if anyone is wondering why it hums, it's because it doesn't know the words ~ Dad Joke

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: Did not mount to my U2718Q monitor or the base, so it sits on the desktop. Otherwise a solid piece of equipment.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: It is nice overall but it doesnt mount on other monitors other than Dell's own.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: Great product for the price. Clear and concise sound. Fits perfectly at the base of my computer.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: This bar does not come with the mount so it just sits on the desk. Felt like it was misrepresented by the pic and description

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment:
No A/C power supply needed. No drivers needed. Instantly recognized by Windows 10. I keep my laptop closed and tucked away. I just use a large external monitor and external keyboard. My monitor does not have audio, so I needed an external speaker for zoom and team chats. This is perfect. I used alien tape and attached to a shelf above my monitor. I tossed the DELL connector since my monitor is LG. The audio is better than my Surface Book Pro put out. It's not a BOSE, but it's fine.

Originally, I was going to get a BT speaker. But quickly discovered there is a lag in the audio when you use BT. Fine for streaming music, but awful for video meetings.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment:
Unlike most so called "USB Soundbars" available these days, this one truely is!

I needed a small speaker for my "dissapearing home office" where my goal is to have a single USB-C cable connection to my laptop for all peripherals. This speaker only requires a USB connection, no need for a separate analog audio cable, so it fits the bill perfectly! Sound is excellent for it's size.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: This sound bar works great BUT just be aware that is comes with a built in design/clips to attach to the bottom of a monitor and not all monitors have the accompanying clip. Maybe that's just a Dell thing? I ended up attaching mine with Velcro instead. This is probably more of a comment for your monitors rather than any sound bar. I also liked how it has a headphone jack which was a feature I was looking for since most don't have that. It also worked seamlessly with the volume controls from my computer, Microsoft.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment:
Bought this to replace using headphones during Zoom meetings. The sound is really good and can be quite loud. With my desktop volume set to the highest level, I only have the speakers at 10-12. I've never even pushed the full extent of the sound as I'm sure it's louder than I would ever need. Quality of the sound is good too.

Doesn't attach to my version of monitor, so I have to just rest it on the monitor base. Doesn't look the best but I'm not bothered by that.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: Got this to add to my Dell P2720DC monitor. I use this for nothing more than Zoom/WebEx/Skype/Teams calls. The sound quality for the calls is fantastic and so is the microphone quality for people on the other end. I will watch the occasional YouTube video or CNN new story here and there too. Overall very pleased. If you are looking for dynamic sound, bass, etc., this is not for you. If you are looking for a great speaker that is seamless with video calling apps for work, this is for you.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: Love how this sounds for calls but not great for music. Best part is that there are no cables on my desk as this attaches to my monitor.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: I purchased this sound bar for my new Dell monitor, assuming it would be similar to the older model I had that was 11 years old. Everything was great, sound was great (for an inexpensive monitor sound bar), it mounted easily... Then I went to turn it off and realized there is no "off" switch. My old Dell speaker bar would turn off via the volume control knob. Not this one. You can hear the hiss of white noise, and there is NO WAY TO TURN IT OFF. I also thought maybe I could do it via the windows audio controls. Nope. So, if you like to work in a quiet space like I do, this sound bar is a terrible option. Unless you want to plug in/unplug a USB cord every time. What an unfortunate, ridiculous design flaw.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: Nice soundbar. Mounted on Dell monitor S2419HGF without problem. Plugged in to usb port on monitor. Looks good- sounds good.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: This mounts nicely on a Dell P2720DC monitor. It's pictured mounted about as high as possible, so it does eat a little space if you have things on the desk under your monitor. Works nicely with Teams and also Cisco IP Communicator. I was expecting much worse sound after reading the reviews here, but it's surprisingly good for a small soundbar. If you're disappointed in the sound quality, you have unrealistic expectations, or a poor grasp of physics. Perfectly adequate for listening to music while working, and great volume. At 100 volume (Windows 10 volume slider, via USB audio connection) I didn't hear any distortion, though it's way, way too loud to be pleasant. 30 is about right. The included 3.5mm cable is pictured--it's a little short to use for anything other than a phone or tablet.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment:
It's a nifty idea to hang an all-in-one PC speaker directly on (or under) the monitor! I wish more manufacturers did this as the final presentation looks really nice and elegant! All the wiring can be out of sight, this little speaker / monitor setup is great for smaller desks and tight places. The design is space-saving and very functional - I love having a master PHYSICAL volume knob for my PC audio.

Overall it's a great product - if you're buying it and expecting MEGA BASS and ear-drum destroying loudness, then you're setting yourself up for disappointment. It is strictly a business tool meant to aid in teleconferencing (Skype and what not) and meant to add decent PC audio to your otherwise speaker-less Dell monitor without complicated wiring or extra bulk. Great for watching YouTube videos or listening to background music while working. It certainly beats the internal speakers of my Microsoft Surface Pro that is docked to my Dell UltraSharp monitor!

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: This works very well and provides a nice sound. It looks good and fits nicely under to the monitor. Would give it a 5th start if could be a little louder with more base or an output to connect a subwoofer.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: Worth money, decent sound, easy to use, clicks right onto the Dell monitor stand.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: I bought this for my wife, she wanted a small speaker out of the way. We set it up in a Samsung monitor and you can barely set it, the adapter works for other brands. The sound is surprisingly good for the size and price of the product. Great, great value!!!

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: As described - new inbox Dell ACM511M soundbar. Fits many of the previous generation monitors but not ones after 2020.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment:
As a lot of us are working from home, and some of us spend all day in meetings, wearing a headset all day can get tiresome. After reading the reviews here, I decided to purchase this. It has been flawless!

People I talk to think I'm wearing a headset. It doesn't pick up fan noise of my laptop which is directly underneath it. My voice is picked up clearly when I talk. There is absolutely no echo feedback.

This thing is great. What a fantastic buy. I'm super happy with it for my meetings and the quality is perfect.

I'm not using this to play music or videos. I only use it for conference calls and basic Windows sounds.

I'd highly recommend this for anyone wanting a speakerphone like environment for their home office.

Well done Dell!

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: I've used this soundbar when teaching a hybrid class, part of those attending were in the room and others were online. The soundbar works well enough that the people in the room could hear the folks on Zoom when they were talking, and the speaker in the soundbar also picks up the folks in the room talking so those online can hear. I'm sure there are more expensive options available, but this works very well for us.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment:
Read the instructions people. If you have a dell monitor, look on the bottom edge for 2 stickers. peel those off to expose the slots. Ditch the mount that comes with the speaker and slide the tabs into the slots you exposed on the monitor. It should look like the main picture in this listing.
I ordered a "used" one and it was mint. Might get another since I have dual monitors. I love the usb cable so I'm not fiddling with dozens of cords. Volume control is nice and easy. This thing worked with linux and windows with no drivers or any hassle whatsoever.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: replaced a speakers that stopped working

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: I have 4 Dell monitors and not one of them fits the bracket that comes with this soundbar. That aside, I am very pleased with the soundbar, the installation, and the quality of sound. You aren't getting a 500 watt soundbar, so you won't get the highest quality sound; but for typical computer work (and I use it a lot for background music and video conferencing) it is very nice. Great price range and great sound for the price. It fits easily on all my monitor stands, so sits below the monitor screen. I like the volume control also, because it's easier to use than going to the computer Sound setting if a presentation is too soft or loud.

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M
comment: Nice bar, wish a bit more volume, great value for money!

theproduct: Dell æˆ´çˆ¾ Stereo SoundBar- AC511M

Unfortunately I'm going to have to order a new speaker already.

comment: I have a 24 inch Dell Inspiron, model HA65Ns5-00 3475AIO all in one computer, and a Dell inspiron 15 7000, 2 in one. Both power brinks were toasted during a storm. While both power supplies look identical, 3.34A 19V 65W etc, they are not. When ordering these power supplies, be very careful to look at the exact model number to make sure your unit is specifically listed. Papa Dell has embedded an identification code in the brick so only one specific brick can be used without issues. For example, my 3475 does not recognize this power brick and will not boot up. Ordered two, and it works on my 7000 series.

comment: I use this everyday and it works fine. I was surprised that the USB cable was permanently attached unlike the original. I had intended to substitute a cable with a right angle connector. Instead, I bought a 90-degree adapter. Bottom line: it works fine.

comment:
. . . it is a genuine 65W Dell charger. Bought it to use with my MSI Summit Flip-EVO 14 for travel purposes. I mistakenly thought it would be the same compact and lightweight dimensions as the one for my Dell XPS 13, but it is much larger and bulkier. So the 65W charger body is quite long and heavy. The power cord is thick and beefy so that is heavy too. If you are using this for international travel, will add a decent bit of weight to your carry-on or check-in luggage.
